comment.body: @Eibriel: There is [a poster](https://www.artlebedev.ru/susha/) by Art. Lebedev Studio, that shows country sizes in the same scale, without distortions caused by a cylindrical map projection.
It will, if we implement it.

@Zeroconfig:
IMO, it's more convenient to use an implementation in python, without compiled code.
https://github.com/bmuller/kademlia
https://github.com/nitmir/btdht

DHT lookups are slow, but DHT is more reliable in the conditions of poor network connectivity or censorship. On the other hand, trackers are fast, but can be easily banned. We need the both approaches.
It can be implemented on the level of a zite engine, so it's up to zite devs. We should probably have a js library for this, though.
Yeah I know it. I tried using it for some time. However, I don't trust enough to its developers. Isn't Tor browser a better choice?
Looks like GFW isn't quite effective in blocking ZeroNet.

My laptop seems to prefer peers from China:

```
China 1821 peers
United States 488 peers
Russia 84 peers
Australia 72 peers
Germany 67 peers
France 58 peers
Netherlands 58 peers
Canada 45 peers
Singapore 40 peers
United Kingdom 36 peers
Hong Kong 36 peers
Brazil 35 peers
Japan 30 peers
Poland 26 peers
```
Mint? Zorin? No idea. I've been using ArchLinux for 10 years now, and it works fine. :P

God, I have 24h in a day, and most of the time I normally sleep, eat, get stuck in traffic jams, work for money and do other stupid things ordinary people do. Sometimes I write some code for free. Your contributions are welcome.

> I don't have code to contribute. Sorry.

At least you can write some guides for newcomers or search over the network and bring some docs made by others and maybe bring some ideas how the information should be organized on ZeroHello or somewhere else. Dude, seriously, your  proposal for me to write beginner's guide in English is out of the common sense bounds. I bet you've found a hacker volunteer with Fabrice Bellard's productivity and skills, so I with my poor man's python code may just go and write the fucking manuals.

@Styromaniac: Perhaps something needs to be added to the official documentation. (My forked repo: https://github.com/zeronet-enhanced/Documentation ... I should make a zite for it...)

Other parts may be organized as a ZeroWiki (any better engine?) with limited editing access. And in various ZeroNet menus, panels etc we can place links to the specific pages about specific questions.
